item.title: How do i
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

after you hit new frame, you then literally drag the text to where you want the ending position to be. Then when you use ‘tween’, it will automatically do all of the in-between steps FOR you.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i
item.dc:creator: @legendzpker legendzpker
item.description:
@legendzpker wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:8, topic:73215”]you would first have to open the animation window. window>animate
then you take the text layer you want, and place it where you want it to start. Then hit ‘new frame’ in the animate bar. After that, you move the text to where you want it to end. now find the ‘tween’ on the animate bar that looks like a bunch of dots.

put it at these settings

and you can change the amount of frames in between to vary the speed.
lastly, you go to file>‘save optimized as’ and then save it as a .gif, and your good to go. hope it works.

I got all of these images from google.com. try it sometime.[/quote]

Umm when i hit new frame i get the same frame as the first and how do i move it

Read full topic

item.title: How do i
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

you would first have to open the animation window. window>animate
then you take the text layer you want, and place it where you want it to start. Then hit ‘new frame’ in the animate bar. After that, you move the text to where you want it to end. now find the ‘tween’ on the animate bar that looks like a bunch of dots.

put it at these settings

and you can change the amount of frames in between to vary the speed.
lastly, you go to file>‘save optimized as’ and then save it as a .gif, and your good to go. hope it works.

I got all of these images from google.com. try it sometime.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:4, topic:73215”][quote author=LegendaryLoser link=topic=107604.msg1078134#msg1078134 date=1175490731]
Create text
press ctrl and j
move it
repeat ctrl and j (copying the layers) until it’s where you like
make all the layers invisible except the first one
in the tool bar click window
click animation
click t elittle piece of paper, it’s duplicate
now, make the first layer invisible, then make the second visible
repeat until done
[/quote]

or you can just “tween”
I think I made a tut on here. If not, somebody else did.[/quote]
edit> adjustments > tween

Read full topic

item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

Create text
press ctrl and j
move it
repeat ctrl and j (copying the layers) until it’s where you like
make all the layers invisible except the first one
in the tool bar click window
click animation
click t elittle piece of paper, it’s duplicate
now, make the first layer invisible, then make the second visible
repeat until done
